name: Summer Workshop - Kids Aerial Yoga with Cindy
location: The Yoga Room, 104 Jervois Street 4th Floor Hong Kong, HKI
about: Think your kid would love floating in the air? They totally will! This Kids Aerial Yoga Summer Workshop series involves using a soft fabric hammock or swing suspended from the ceiling to perform yoga poses, stretches, and gentle acrobatics.Dates: 21 July -29 Aug 2025, Every Monday & FridayTime: Monday 11am-12pm / Friday 3-4pmFee: HK300@class, HK250@class if you kid joins 5 sessions or aboveVenue: 3/F, The Yoga RoomPerfect for active kids who love to moveâ€”no experience needed!*Benefits of Aerial Yoga for Kids*1. *Improves Strength & Flexibility* â€“ Kids develop core, arm, and leg strength while stretching their muscles safely.2. *Boosts Confidence* â€“ Learning new poses and inversions helps build self-esteem.3. *Enhances Balance & Coordination* â€“ The hammock challenges stability and spatial awareness.4. *Encourages Mindfulness & Relaxation* â€“ Gentle swinging and deep breathing promote calmness.5. *Makes Fitness Fun* â€“ It feels like playing while exercising!Enquiry and Sign Up: Please drop us an email at info@yogaroomhk.com / call 2544-8398 / WhatsApp +852 6685 9097 (Click to start chat) for details.

name: Floating Aromatic Sound Bath on Aerial Hammocks with Audrey
location: The Yoga Room, 104 Jervois Street 4th Floor Hong Kong, HKI
about: Date: 20 July 2025 (Sunday)Time: 4-5:15pmVenue: 3/F, The Yoga RoomFee: HK$350 per personThis unique healing experience combines restorative hammock yoga, aromatic meditation and nourishing soundscapes to bring you a deeply soothing session. Relax in weightless suspension as sound alchemist Audrey Yiu guides you through a surround sound & meditative journey with aromatherapy oils, delivering instant stress relief while gong and singing bowl vibrations promote circulation, relaxation and rejuvenation.The class is suitable for both beginners and experienced meditators.Capacity is limited.Please drop us an email at info@yogaroomhk.com / call 2544-8398 / WhatsApp 6685-9097 (Click to start chat) for details.Booking can also be made directly through our office, please contact us.*No refund is allowed in this event.

name: Otherwise Employed
location: 16/f Chun Wo Commercial Centre, 23-27 Wing Wo Street Sheung Wan, HKI
about: What it isOtherwise Employed is a peer group for anyone who is unemployed or not working full time and finding it hard. Lots of things make being â€˜Otherwise Employedâ€™ hard. You might be in this position involuntarily, experiencing financial pressures, loss of identity, routine, or purpose, facing rejection in your job search, feeling lonely, or uncertain about the future.This is a forum for people to share the difficult emotions around not being in full-time employment, which provides not only income but also an identity, structure to your day, social contact, and often a purpose.What this is not- A forum to discuss the practicalities of job searches- A networking opportunityWhat happensA peer support group is where people come together to share personal stories, listen and support one another with kindness. You will be welcomed by two hosts who are trained TNN volunteers with lived experience in the topic of the group. It is normal to feel nervous, and sharing can be a big decision. Remember you are deserving of care and support. You are welcome to join us and just listen.Our hosts will welcome you and provide an introduction, then we will ask you to introduce yourself and your reason for joining us. From then on there is no pressure to speak. Our hosts will facilitate conversation.A peer support group is a supportive space where people can:Share stories and how our experiences are currently impacting our livesTalk about our feelings and emotionsShare and discuss coping strategiesGroup guidelinesWe have some basic guidance that we ask everyone to adhere to, to ensure this remains an inclusive space for everyone:Our groups are confidential; please donâ€™t discuss specifics outside of the space, and no recording of the group is permitted.This is a space for you to share your experience honestly and without judgement or expectation.There is never any pressure to speak or share if you do not wish to. You are welcome to join and just listen.Â Please give the speaker our full attention: the person sharing should be the only one speaking.Â If the co-host or I step in to redirect the conversation either due to the interest of time or going off topic, we are not cutting you off.Â Please be kind to yourself and each other.Â Please listen with compassion.Â We do not compare here, everyoneâ€™s experience is valid and to be respected.Â Please noteAs a peer support group, this group is for peers to share their personal struggles and support one another. Attendees are welcome to come and listen but it is not a space to observe. You should attend to engage in peer support. It is not a space for students to contribute to their studies, for clinicians to observe, or for the press unless written agreement from the charity has been obtained.Who are The New Normal Charity?We are a Hong Kong S88 registered charity. The New Normal Hong Kong has been hosting our free peer support groups in Hong Kong since 2022. Our groups are facilitated by volunteers. While our hosts are trained to facilitate, we are not mental health professionals in this space. We do not give advice, we provide space for all of you to share, connect and support. Nobody should ever feel alone, and there is always somebody who can relate to your story.www.thenewnormalcharityhk.orgIf you are in crisis and donâ€™t feel like you can keep yourself safe there are immediate services available.Â å±æ©Ÿæ±‚åŠ©ç†±ç·šå¦‚æœä½ è¦ºå¾—ä½ ä¸èƒ½ä¿è­‰è‡ªå·±çš„å®‰å…¨Samaritans 2341 7227 (until 10pm) 2389 2222 (24/7)Caritas 18288SPS Hotline 23820000AddressWYNGÂ 16/F, Chun Wo Commercial Centre23-27 Wing Wo Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong IslandÂ How to get there2 minute walk from Sheung Wan Station:From Exit E1, turn right and walk along Des Voeux Rd Central. Cross Wing Lok Street, then turn right onto Wing Wo Street (the first street after you cross). The building will be on your left.

name: Complicated Grief
location: The Hive Wan Chai, 23 Luard Road 9/F Wan Chai, HKI
about: What it is:Complicated Grief is a supportive space for those who feel their grief comes with added complexities, no matter the circumstance. Our peer-led groups provide a supportive and understanding environment for anyone navigating grief influenced by factors such as, but not limited to, suicide loss, estrangement, being cut off or distant from the person who died, traumatic loss, multiple losses, relationship breakdown or stigma.What happens:A peer support group is where people come together to share personal stories, listen and support one another with kindness. You will be welcomed by two hosts who are trained TNN volunteers with lived experience on the topic of the group. It is normal to feel nervous, and sharing can be a big decision. Remember you are deserving of care and support. You are welcome to join us and just listen.Our hosts will welcome you and provide an introduction, then we will ask you to introduce yourself and your reason for joining us. From then on there is no pressure to speak. Our hosts will facilitate the conversation.A peer support group is a supportive space where people can:Share stories and how our experiences are currently impacting our livesTalk about our feelings and emotionsShare and discuss coping strategiesGroup guidelines:We have some basic guidelines that we ask everyone to adhere to, to ensure this remains an inclusive space for everyone:Our groups are confidential; please donâ€™t discuss specifics outside of the space, and no recording of the group is permitted.This is a space for you to share your experience honestly and without judgement or expectation.There is never any pressure to speak or share if you do not wish to. You are welcome to join and just listen.Please give the speaker our full attention: the person sharing should be the only one speaking.If the co-host or I step in to redirect the conversation either due to the interest of time or going off topic, we are not cutting you off.Please be kind to yourself and each other.Please listen with compassion.We do not compare here, everyoneâ€™s experience is valid and to be respected.Please note:As a peer support group, this group is for peers to share their personal struggles and support one another. Attendees are welcome to come and listen but it is not a space to observe. You should attend to engage in peer support. It is not a space for students to contribute to their studies, for clinicians to observe, or for the press unless written agreement from the charity has been obtained.Who are The New Normal Charity?We are a Hong Kong S88 registered charity. The New Normal Hong Kong has been hosting our free peer support groups in Hong Kong since 2022. Our groups are facilitated by volunteers. While our hosts are trained to facilitate, we are not mental health professionals in this space. We do not give advice, we provide space for all of you to share, connect and support. Nobody should ever feel alone, and there is always somebody who can relate to your story.www.thenewnormalcharityhk.orgIf you are in crisis and donâ€™t feel like you can keep yourself safe, there are immediate services available.å±æ©Ÿæ±‚åŠ©ç†±ç·šå¦‚æœä½ è¦ºå¾—ä½ ä¸èƒ½ä¿è­‰è‡ªå·±çš„å®‰å…¨Samaritans 2341 7227 (until 10pm) 2389 2222 (24/7)Caritas 18288SPS Hotline 23820000AddressThe Hive Wan Chai9/F, The Phoenix, 23 Luard Rd, Wan Chai, Hong KongHow to get thereÂ 3 minute walk from Wan Chai Station:From Exit C, turn left and walk along Lockhart Road. Turn right when you reach Luard Road. Walk up Luard Road â€“ The Phoenix will be on your left.

name: Resilience Fundamentals @ Hong Kong
location: The Langham, Hong Kong, 8 Peking Road Tsim Sha Tsui, KOW
about: Unlock the Resilience Mastery Inside You with this High-Value Workshop by The International Resilience Institute Sydney (IRIS)We welcome you to a transformative learning experience with IRIS, where we know that resilience is not just a trait that some are born with; it's a skill to be honed and mastered...Our exclusive IRIS RESILIENCE FUNDAMENTALS workshop emerged from cutting-edge research, revealing two crucial insights:1. Resilience is Not Innate: It can be learned.2. Resilience Grows with Practice: Applying resilient thinking and behaviors in daily life enhances personal resilience.This seminar is presented in English.

name: 200-hours Yoga Teacher Training Certificate Course
location: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: Who we areAnahata Yoga is a premiere yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga.As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle.About the courseAnahata Yogaâ€™s 200 Hours Teacher Training Certificate course gives yoga practitioners, enthusiasts, and aspiring instructors the chance to deepen their self-knowledge of yoga philosophy and improve on various aspects of their practice. It is an open-level training programme, suitable for those who have never done yoga before as well as those who have put in years of practice.Through the course, students gain a better understanding of yogaâ€™s origins, history, as well as its philosophy. Students also learn how they may improve on their postures, that they may execute them with accuracy and, later, be able to demonstrate it to others.Why us?We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centres in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference.Our courses are accredited by and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a programme is being offered.Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programmes give students more in-depth learning that they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong.

name: Grounding Techniques for Arm Balances, BackbendsÂ &Â Inversions
dateTime: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart
location: The Yoga Room, 104 Jervois Street 4th Floor Hong Kong, HKI
about: By grounding, we are connecting the energy to the earth and obtaining stability; While by centering, we bring the energy into our body and our core. In this workshop, Jackie is going to introduce the techniques of grounding and centering. Also, we are going to explore how these techniques are going to help our Asana practice.Dates: 10,24 Aug + 21,28 Sept 2025 (Sundays)Time: 11:15am-1:15pmFee: HK$450@session, HK$1,520 for all 4 sessionsVenue: The Yoga RoomFoundation: understanding about grounding and centeringDate: 10 Aug2025Physical practice and breathing exercises, alongside with basic anatomy will be introduced.Arm BalanceDate: 24 Aug2025Arm balance asanas will be introduced. In this workshop, Jackie will explain how grounding and Centering helps getting into the poses and also the anatomical knowledge behind them.BackbendingsDate: 21 Sept 2025Grounding and Centering are helpful in obtaining a safe backbending practice. In this workshop, Jackie will guide you through how to do the backbending postures with the techniques of grounding and Centering.InversionsDate: 28 Sept 2025In this final workshop we will use the techniques we learnt previously about grounding and centering to practice inversions.Enquiry and Sign Up: Please drop us an email at info@yogaroomhk.com / call 2544-8398 / WhatsApp +852 6685 9097 (Click to start chat) for details.*No refund is allowed for this event

location: The Yoga Room, 104 Jervois Street 4th Floor Hong Kong, HKI
about: ğŸ“Œ Price: â Level 1+2: HK$9,500 (Early-bird) HK$10,800 (Regular)Level 1: HK$ 6,300Level 2: HK$4,600ğŸ“Œ Dates:Level 1: 23-26 Aug, 2025 (Sat-Tue)Time: 8:30am-5pmLevel 2: 29-31 Aug 2025 (Fri-Sun)Time: 8:30am â€“ 4:30pm (Friday & Saturday)Time: 8:30am â€“ 3:30pm (Sunday)ğŸ“Œ Venue: The Yoga RoomLevel 1: (30 hours)Materials Covered:The YogaWise Yin Yoga Teacher Training (Level 1) is designed for students and teachers who wish to develop a deeper knowledge of this multifaceted yoga style, and emerge with a working definition and basic teaching methodology for Yin Yoga. There will be a strong emphasis on Anatomy, highlighting skeletal variations, the role of connective tissue, and the nervous system. An introduction to mindfulness meditation will address the non-physical nature of this profoundly quieting practice.Key Features of the YogaWise Yin Yoga Training (Level 1) include:Whatâ€™s Your Style? Defining Yin Yoga as a Theory & PracticeDaoist perspective â€“ Essence of Yin/Yang applied to Asana & AnatomyKey Yin Postures: Variations on a ShapeYintegration: Introducing Yin to Varied Student Populationsâ€Assessmentâ€ Postures: Finding an Appropriate Edge for Different BodiesSpecific Highlights:Defining Target Areas: A Functional Approach to AsanaUnderstanding Soft-Tissue Tension vs. Structural CompressionWhat is Fascia? Exploring the Global Nature of the Extra-Cellular MaitrixSkeletal Variations: â€Asanalysisâ€ of Our Unique BonesBeginnerâ€™s Mindfulness: Focusing Attention on PurposeLevel 2: (20 hours)Materials covered:The YogaWise Yin Yoga Teacher Training (Level 2) is designed for current Yin teachers or those already familiar with the basic orientation and language of Yin Yoga. This 20-Hour Level 2 course offers a closer examination of upper-body anatomy , and integrates the concept of myofascial meridians with practical sequencing strategies for both Yin and Yang classes. The course will also explore creative solutions and variations of Yin postures for students with limitations.Key Features of the YogaWise Yin Yoga Training (Level 2) include:Upper-Body Anatomy: Mapping the Shoulder GirdleWhat Limits Our Movement? Movement Tests for Shoulder GirdleTargeting Myofascial Tracks: From Mandalas to MeridiansPosture Orientation: Creative Solutions to Postural LimitationsMindfulness in Practice: Incorporating Meditation In YinSpecific Highlights:Introduction to Myofascial MeridiansYin + Yang Sequencing Themes: Stimulating the Myofascial TracksFunctional Anatomy for YinMapping the Shoulder Girdle: Identifying MyoFascial Groupsâ€Asanalysisâ€: Tension vs. Compression at Shoulder GirdlePostural Variations:Change the Pose, not the Student: Working With Postural LimitationsMindfulness in Practice:Yin Yoga: Gateway to Meditation PracticeAbout David Kim:DAVID KIM (E-RYT500) is a U.S.-based international Senior Yoga Teacher Trainer, who teaches both Yin and Vinyasa (YogaWorks) styles, and has led numerous 200- and 300-Hour Teacher Trainings, workshops, and retreats across the globe. Davidâ€™s passionate embrace of Yin Yoga owes a deep debt of gratitude to his mentors Paul & Suzee Grilley; to Sarah Powersâ€™s meditative grace; to the cumulative wisdom of cutting-edge anatomy and movement teachers; and to the dedicated students who have accompanied him along this path towards personal and spiritual awareness.David is a registered Continuing Education provider with Yoga Alliance (USA), and taking this course will allow you to receive 20, 30 or 50 Hours of Continuing Education credit with YA.Enquiry and Sign Up: Please drop us an email at info@yogaroomhk.com / call 2544-8398 / WhatsApp +852 6685 9097 (Click to start chat) for details.

name: 30-hr Yoga Nidra Teacher Training with Scott Moore
location: The Yoga Room, 104 Jervois Street 4th Floor Hong Kong, HKI
about: What Makes This Training Unique:- Learn from a Yoga Nidra master to become a Yoga Nidra expert- Develop your authentic teaching voice rather than becoming a rote version of your teacher- Receive practical tools to create successful teaching opportunities- Gain immediate access to online course materials upon registration- Experience Scott's live online Yoga Nidra classes to observe expert facilitationWhat You'll Receive:- 30 hours of expert, in-depth Yoga Nidra Teacher Training- Comprehensive 160-page manual with scripts, exercises, and resources- PDF collection of over 100 pages of Yoga Nidra scripts- Lifetime access to all training recordings- Access to online course content for deeper study- Personal 30-minute consultation with Scott- Access to weekly live online Yoga Nidra classes- Yoga Alliance Continuing Education credit- Certificate of completion- Access to supportive online community

name: 100-hours Pranayama and Meditation Teacher Training Course
location: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: Who we areAnahata Yoga is a premiere yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga.As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle.About the courseAnahata Yoga's 100 Hours Pranayama & Meditation Teacher Training Certificate Course gives yoga practitioners, enthusiasts, and aspiring instructors the chance to learn the art of mindfulness and mindful living. Through the course, students gain a better understanding of the basics of breathing, concentration and meditation techniques and how it influences the body and mind.Why us?We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centers in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference.Our courses are accredited by and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a program is being offered.Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programs give students more in-depth learning that they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong.

name: 300-hours Yoga Therapy and Ayurveda Teacher Training Certificate Course
location: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: Who we areAnahata Yoga is a premier yoga center based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga.As a center, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle.Why us?We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centers in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference.Our courses are accredited by, and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a programme is being offered.Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline, but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programmes give students more in-depth learning than they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong.About the Yoga Therapy and AyurvedaYoga therapy and Ayurveda may be worlds apart, but through this specially-designed course, participants will be given a good introduction to the two sciences as well as a solid foundation on which to build their knowledge. The course is a good starting point for those interested in learning more about these two subjects. Explore the principles of yoga therapy and Ayurveda and their various applications in our daily lives. Understand the body, its functions and how to address common ailments through various yogic practice and Ayurvedic diet principles.

name: 100-hours Kids Yoga Teacher Training (Saturday Morning and Afternoon)
location: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: Who we areAnahata Yoga is a premier yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga.As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle.What is kids yoga?Starting a yoga practice at a young age creates a healthy life for youngsters. By nature, childrenâ€™s minds and bodies are flexible, adaptable and easily teachable. So long as yoga is fun, creative and interactive, itâ€™s an activity theyâ€™re sure to like. In addition to being a great physical activity, yoga offers an entertaining way for children to learn about the mind and body, and their functions and abilities.Children also learn to balance their emotions and improve their focus and concentration through yoga. Various studies have shown that children who regularly practice yoga have better health and emotional balance, and are less likely to be afflicted with common health issues such as allergies, asthma, digestive disorders, obesity, ADD and ADHD.At Anahata Yoga, parents who enjoy yoga also pave the way for their children to enjoy the activity, making yoga a regular family activity and cultivating a healthy lifestyle. And just as yoga can be tailored according to the needs and capacities of every individual, so can kidsâ€™ yoga be designed to match the interests of every individual child â€“ not only ensuring a healthy body and mind, but also some fun and laughter along the way.Benefits of yoga for kidsYoga helps improve strength and flexibility.Yoga increases concentration, focus, and attention.Kidâ€™s yoga increases self â€“ esteem.Yoga decreases anxiety and increases ability to relax.About Kids Yoga Teacher Training CourseAnahata Yogaâ€™s Kidsâ€™ Yoga Teacher Training Course (100 hours) is one of the first accredited Certification Programme for Kidâ€™s yoga in Hong Kong. Anahata Yoga offers a solid foundational grounding of yoga instruction and mindful yoga practices for children. Students learn the physiology and psychology of children of various age groups, and how to incorporate yoga to their leisure time as a hobby, a sport, and a discipline in a fun and creative way.â€œIt takes a big heart to shape little minds,â€ it is said. At Anahata Yoga, students learn to teach kidsâ€™ yoga from the heart. At the end of our programme, students will be able to confidently teach yoga to children and design creative yoga classes for children of various age groups.The course is best suitedRegular Yoga practitioners to deepen your yoga knowledgeYoga instructorsSchool TeachersPhysical Education teachersPediatriciansPediatric Psychiatric Nurse PractitionersFor further details, please click the link below:https://anahatayoga.com.hk/training_workshop/100-hours-kids-yoga-teacher-training-saturday-morning-and-afternoon-2/

name: TNN YOGA - relaxing stretch & sound healing
location: The Yoga Lane, 27 High Street #B/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: So what is this yoga class?The class will focus on holding yoga poses mindfully for 2-5 minutes to allow participants to stretch out tired muscles and find a space to relax and restore without the hustle and bustle of the city noise. This class will be complemented with sound healing to help with further relaxation. We hope to hold space for participants to embark on an inward experience to release stress and find ease in the body and the mind. Suitable for all levels, with modifications and variations offered to accommodate all participants. Bilingual instructions will also be on offer.We aim to make fitness for mental health accessible in Hong Kong. Thatâ€™s why we offer places in our classes for free for those experiencing financial hardship.Each TNN Yoga class costs $705HKD, $255 is an NGO discounted rental of the space and $450 goes to our amazing instructor(s) as we believe in fair pay.If you donate, you will be â€˜paying it forwardâ€™ and providing a space in our next yoga class for someone facing financial hardship.We want everyone to have access to the support they need, regardless of their identity or circumstance.Please note we will be hosting our classes at Yoga Lane STUDIO 2 unless otherwise stated.Schedule for this series:29th May - Heinok & Valerie (sound healing)5th June - Heinok & Mina (movement)12th June - Heinok & Marcus (sound healing)19th June - Heinok26th June - Heinok & Christy (sound healing)3rd July - Heinok & Terence (Wall rope special)10th July - Heinok17th July - HeinokMove PartnersTaking part in physical activity can improve mental health in many ways; better sleep, happier moods, managing stress, anxiety, and intrusive thoughts, improved self-esteem, and connection to the community, to name a few.Move Partners is a collaborative project between The New Normal Charity and organisations, professionals, and athletes. We aim to reinforce the connection and the importance of moving to help support our mental health.So who are we?The New Normal CharityThe New Normal Charity is a Hong Kong registered S88 charity 91/19147. We offer free peer support groups for mental health. We aim to help and support one another through life's difficult moments. We want everyone to have access to the support they need, regardless of their identity or circumstance. We empower people with lived mental health experiences.We support people living in Hong Kong struggling to access the mental health support they need. Because no one should have to face mental pain alone.HeinokHeinok (she/her) is a yoga instructor, singing bowl sound healer and TNN HK volunteer. Sheâ€™s a RYT-200 yoga instructor with additional training in yin yoga, making yoga accessible and singing bowl sound healing level 1. As a healthcare professional who strongly believes in equality, she is passionate about wellness and accessibility concepts. Thus, you will find her teaching with a lot of anatomical cues and modifications as she leads you through her carefully curated functional flows. Tied with her passion for mental health empowerment and advocacy, her life goal of sharing with people that â€˜movement is a form of medicineâ€™.

name: Yoga Class with Karen Chiang
dateTime: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart
location: 21/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Kowloon Hong Kong, KOW 00000
about: Begin your Saturday with intention through a carefully crafted journey of movement and breath. These sessions have been thoughtfully curated by instructor Karen Chiang â€” from a more gentle session in the early morning, to a more energising and invigorating flow session, to a more focused and strength building session that combines yoga and pilates - there is something for all! 8:30 - 9:30am | MORNING FLOWGently awaken your body and mind with our poolside Morning Flow--a nurturing Hatha yoga session perfect for beginners. Suitable for all levels.11:30am - 12:30pm | YOGALATES FLOWDiscover harmony in motion with Yogalates Flow--a mindful fusion of yoga and Pilates that strengthens your core, glutes, and spine mobility. This session deepens your mind-body connection through slow, controlled movements, helping you build strength, flexibility, and centeredness in a balanced, holistic practice.Venue: 21/F, Yoga and Fitness Room, Wellness, Eaton HKAbout Karen:I have been exploring fitness and well-being since 2015. Iâ€™m passionate about helping others fill their own cups and finding stillness in motion. My classes are challenging, but also joyful and calm. I teach uncomplicated sequences in a slow, alignment-based flow, always incorporating meditation and a savoured savasana.*Kindly ask a member of staff on the G/F to let you up to the 21/F upon arrival**Please arrive 10 min before class. Participants may not be allowed inside after the class has started in order to avoid distubances to other participants.

location: Tune In Wellness, 16/F Simsons Commercial Building 137-139 Johnston Rd Wanchai, HKI
about: A unique deep relaxation and meditative surround sound experience with specially crafted gongs, singing bowls and other sound healing instruments.Participants will get to rest in AntiGravity Hammock completely surrounded by sound vibrations.It includes a brief talk about the benefits of sound vibrations, optional special essential oil application, followed by a tranquil soundscape immersion with multiple gongs, singing bowls and other overtone-emitting instruments that give you a sense of clarity and harmony.This nurturing experience will soothe your mind, relax your body, reduce stress, clear energetic blockage while being in a blissful altered state of consciousness so that you can feel good inside out.Simply wear anything comfortable. No experience is required.If there's any pre-existing medical condition please contact me before signing up.Ticket: $380 per person, $700 for two (There's a service charge if you book on Eventbrite), for other payment methods (Payme/FPS/Bank transfer) please email contact@tuneinwell.com to book

name: 100-hours Prenatal Yoga Teacher Training Certificate Course
location: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: Who we areAnahata Yoga is a premiere yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga.As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle.About the courseAnahata Yogaâ€™s Accredited 100 hours Prenatal Yoga Teacher Training Course (RPYT) is a comprehensive prenatal yoga certification program designed to equip aspiring yoga instructors with a strong foundational knowledge of physiology and anatomy in pregnancy. Students of the course will learn to support women in every stage of pregnancy, through delivery, and even into the early days of motherhood.The 100 hours Prenatal Yoga Teacher Training Course is a specialized program for yoga practitioners aspiring to teach yoga to pregnant women. Students are taught how various yogic practices are adapted and modified during various stages of pregnancy and early motherhood. Highly qualified and experienced instructors will teach the physical and mental changes that occur normally in a pregnant body, and how yoga can help promote a smooth pregnancy.At the end of this course, students will be able to deliver specific pre- and post-natal classes for pregnant women.The course is best suitedRegular Yoga practitioners to deepen your yoga knowledgeYoga instructorsFitness trainersPhysiotherapist,Antenatal trainersMassage TherapistEven If you're pregnant and looking for ways to relax or stay fit, you may consider joining our prenatal yoga program.What to expect:Practical tools for teaching a safe and comprehensive prenatal yoga class.A thorough understanding of yoga and its application in various pregnancy-related physical and mental conditions.Learn how to tailor make a sequence for various stages of pregnancy and how to adapt the poses for each individual as per the daily needs and limits.Practice the poses with a dummy pregnant belly to experience the real challenges of the pregnant women during the class.Study materials (provided):Prenatal Yoga sequence PosterPrenatal Yoga Practice ManualWhy us?We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centers in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference.Our courses are accredited by and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a program is being offered.Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programs give students more in-depth learning that they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong.

Anahata Yoga offers a solid foundational grounding of yoga instruction and mindful yoga practices for children. Students learn the physiology and psychology of children of various age groups, and how to incorporate yoga to their leisure time as a hobby, a sport, and a discipline in a fun and creative way.â€œIt takes a big heart to shape little minds,â€ it is said. At the end of our programme, students will be able to confidently teach yoga to children and design creative yoga classes for children of various age groups.For further details, please click the link below:https://anahatayoga.com.hk/training_workshop/100-hours-kids-yoga-teacher-training-mon-wed-evening/

location: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F Hong Kong, HKI

name: 300-hours Advanced Hatha Yoga Teacher Training Course Level 1 â€“ Level 3
location: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: Who we areAnahata Yoga is a premiere yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga.As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle.About Advanced Hatha Yoga Teacher TrainingThe Level 1,2 Advanced Hatha Yoga Teacher Training Certificate Course is for yoga practitioners interested in growing their knowledge of Hatha yoga and developing their techniques in executing various Hatha yoga poses. The course is divided into 3 levels, each of which focuses on basic and intermediate poses, their possible modifications and variations, and teaching and demonstration techniques.The aim of the course is to challenge practitioners to advance in their practice by exploring the limits of their body and overcoming them, as well as to develop their knowledge of the body in order to better understand every joint and muscle nuance in the poses. By the end of the course, participants shall be able to demonstrate the wide range of Hatha yoga poses, explain their possible modifications and variations, and demonstrate the steps required to achieve the pose.What do I learn from each level?Levels 1 and 2 of the course are of the same level of intensity but focus on different practical and teaching aspects of advanced practices hatha yoga.Level 1 covers Introduction of Hatha yoga, its origins, the basic anatomical details of the poses and its various approaches from the beginner's point of view. Proper Warm-up and preparatory practices are covered in detail.Level 2, on the other hand, covers other variations of the poses with deeper learning and practice. The student will get to practice many variations and modifications of the poses and learn how to modify as per their limitations.Level 3, students learn the teaching techniques of postures taught in the first two levels, as well as Partner Yoga variations, usage of straps, Chair Yoga, and the art of demonstration.Students also learn to sequence poses, teach the advanced Hatha yoga classes, and develop a class theme that focuses on various levels.As the final level in this series of training, Level 3 prepares students as Advanced Hatha Yoga Teachers.You can first take levels 1 & 2 and then the teacher will decide whether you are ready for level 3, after the completion of level 2 this time or wait for next time. Usually, we will have two advanced YTT in a year.This course is best suited forRegular Yoga PractitionersStudentsYoga TeachersFitness TrainersPilates TrainersSports playersWhy us?We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong.
